text: have a good one the Roosevelt Island
tram closed at the end of februari for
six months 25 million dollar
modernization projects the tram was
supposed to reopen in September but the
project was delayed by an embargo on
permits needed to transport cranes now
it's slated to open late in November but
rounds of test runs units already in the
air David OpenNet has designed built and
installed trams around the world from
Taiwan to Colombia alburnett moved from
France to Roosevelt Island to work on
the project I'm born in the tram
industry since I'm a little boy I'm
coming from this from ski resorts in the
French Alps and always been exposed to
tramway system we've been lucky enough
to process this the East River with the
new tram not scary at all are you
feeling actually very safe in this cabin
so you feel a kick to the towers
sometimes
it's when there's no wait just
commissioning of a bill of the public
transport is always a long process for
an aerial transportation system it's a
little bit longer during renovations
Islanders have had to resort to more
conventional modes of transportation
it's an inconvenience for some but the
tram has had a few shaky moments in the
past after minor incidents in 2003 and
2005 it really made news in April of
2006 with 68 people inside the tram
dangled above the river for almost 12
hours we cope with it we rescue over the
past years nobody was hurt and that's
how serious we turn we take our
responsibility in regards to safety the
new system has built-in features to
prevent safety failures if there are
grid failures for massive generators
will keep the cars running at full speed
the system is more stable so heavy winds
won't affect operations it has a
built-in wireless communication system
and both cabins move independently of
one another when it opens at the end of
november the full ride will take three
minutes during rush hour for many on the
island that day couldn't come soon
enough
